title: Facebook launches 'News Tab' featuring major publishers
text:
Facebook on Friday announced the launch of its news tab on the social media platform.

"Today we’re starting to test Facebook News, a dedicated place for news on Facebook, to a subset of people in the US," said news product manager Mona Sarantakos and vice president of global news partnerships Campbell Brown in a statement.

ADVERTISEMENT

"News gives people more control over the stories they see, and the ability to explore a wider range of their news interests, directly within the Facebook app," they added.

Facebook News will feature top stories curated by a team of reporters, personalization for users based on news they interact with and sections with topics so that people can easily find stories focused on business, entertainment, health and other subjects.

Users will also be allowed to link their paid news subscriptions and hide articles, topics and publishers they don't want to see.

Publishers that appear on the platform will need to be in Facebook's news page index and follow its publisher guidelines.

The Hill is one of the news publishers participating in the launch of the news tab.

Articles will also continue to appear on the site's news feed as they do today.

“Journalism plays a critical role in our democracy. When news is deeply-reported and well-sourced it gives people information they can rely on. When it’s not, we lose an essential tool for making good decisions," said Brown and Sarantakos.

The company has faced some criticism for its handling of news in the past.

Critics have said the company has not done enough to prevent the spread of misinformation on its platform, although it has taken down accounts linked to fake news.

Facebook has also been accused of inflating its video metrics, which many called a factor in the “pivot to video” that resulted in layoffs of nonvideo journalists.
description: Facebook on Friday announced the launch of its news tab on the social media platform.
